title: Why Getting out of bronze is so difficult
body:
Wait wait wait... I know you've got your message saying I'm just bad and need to improve but look at this screenshot of this round.

http://s18.postimg.org/p9sytfhm1/why_you_can_t_get_out_of_bronze.png

Yup, that's right. 

Believe it or not but matches like this are a common occurence in bronze, extremely common.

Thresh trying to 1v1 quinn giving 1st blood.
Mid lane just feeding really hard.
All extemely common.

After winning 8/10 placement matches and getting placed into bronze 4 (WTF)
I have experienced the most cancerous experience league could offer.

Riot, please fix bronze.

replies.body:
just ban yas, i find its less because he is so strong, more because allies pick him thinkking they going to smash so hard because he is "easy and op" but then they feed so hard because he isn't he needs skill to do well, the stats show ~70% of people playing yasuo who think he is "easy and op" feed and lose.

I got out by banning yas so allies didnt pick him, because i tell you, every single game i had a yas on my team they fed so freaking hard and sucked so much freaking i wanted to friendly fire them for desecrating him.

its always the sucky as yasuo
omg i relate to this on a spiritual level. And I'm not in any way saying I'm a good Yas, I'm probs the wost of them all

Yet people can still climb out...

It's weird considering I got placed in Bronze 3, got to Bronze 1, tilted all the way back to bronze 4 then carried out to Silver.

On Support, mostly.

{{champion:37}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:25}} 

The thing is, Bronze is only as bad as you make it. I've been bronze for 3 seasons now and I havent had half of the stuff happen to me that people complain about. From my experience it's not the stomping of others that helps you climb it's your _attitude_ 

If you go in expecting people to feed, do poorly, or flame them for 1v1ing Quinn your gonna have a bad time. The more you just go with the flow and accept that you cant win every game. the easier it gets.

Nami is always the right answer.

You call that a bad game of bronze I went to spectate a bronze V to see how bad it is and I saw a game where:
- the red team was 7-52.
- the blue team was 14-12.

- Blue buff golem had a 7-1 kill streak.
- Baron got 12 kills never died.
- Raptors were not touched once expect by a sunfire cape. Which for some reason was on an ad Syndra.
- Only 5 wards were used on both teams.
- I believe only 1 ping was used.
- Full AD Nami jg was red team. (which for some reason was 3-9)

and you call your game bad...?

How many Ranked games have you played? Not enough by the sounds of it. I have like 100 Ranked games, got into Silver. You need to play enough games to have what happened to you also happen to the enemy.

What sucks is the bad luck when you get 3-4 of these games in a row when you are in placement matches, that hurts. But over the long run, like 500+ games you will eventually get to the place that your skill dictates.

Yup, the luck really sucks, I got 6 of these in a row when I promoted to bronze 2 one time.

I'll get out eventually though, its just a long and gruelling trip out.
I had 3 Silver 5 Promo's that went down the drain. Before each one I had 4 wins in a row, it's just how it is sometimes.
I climbed out of Bronze three times last year. Three. And that was after being placed in Bronze 5. I'm now in Silver 2. It's not that hard.

Oh gosh I feel this so hard. I've been playing since around season 2, and I've been ranked bronze for s3 and s4. (Like B3 and then B1). Both times I tried my hardest to climb out of bronze. I blamed my team-mates when I lost; considering I mained support, it's not hard to be in this mindset. If I lost lane, although I didnt flame or be toxic and still tried, I'd blame the jungler and adc (sorry). In the end for those two years, I just ended up tilting myself haha. What I learnt THIS year was to rely on myself and play the best I could.

Although I still cant cs, I learnt to roam. Although Im not very good, I learnt other champs and lanes (mid~ kat). I got placed in Bronze 2, and ended up at Gold 5. League is a team-game, and honestly the community is pretty bad so I learnt to MUTE instead of responding. Everyone has their bad days and everyone is human. I honestly think it's up to YOU to climb! learn from your  mistakes. With the new ranked changes in promo's it should be a lot easier tbh :) glhf~

I know how you feel bro. People say it's not other people it's the attitude you have coming into the game but half the people stuck in this situation are nice and caring and just want to have a good game. But they have to go through this bull almost every game and it ruins the experience. Riot doesn't need to fix bronze, they need to do something about the community. FYI I'm talking about trollers and afks not people who have a bad game and feed.
